<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/18/usps-pause-controversial-changes-election-day?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Too Big to Mail
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="USPS mailbox" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTM1L3VzcHNfbWFpbGJveC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Postmaster General Louis DeJoy said <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/08/18/903477948/postmaster-general-will-testify-at-senate-hearing-friday?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">he's pausing</a> controversial changes to the U.S. Postal Service until after Election Day "to avoid even the appearance of any impact on election mail." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What that means: </strong>USPS retail hours will stay the same; mailboxes and mail sorters will stay put; processing facilities will remain open; and overtime will be approved as needed. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">About those changes</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">DeJoy took over USPS in June and enacted some budget-balancing measures to right the ship at the struggling agency. Those measures included...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Eliminating overtime pay </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Leaving mail at distribution centers until the next day if couriers are running late </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>An effort to encourage early retirements for non-union workers </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Reassigning or displacing 23 execs, a move that </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/08/07/postal-service-investigation-dejoy/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">centralized</a></span><span> power around DeJoy and sidelined decades of institutional knowledge, per the WaPo.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, DeJoy specified that initiatives on pause "predate [his] arrival." He did not say whether recently removed or decommissioned mailboxes and sorters will be returned. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>USPS changes have big implications for the many businesses that rely on its services. DeJoy might find himself on Santa's naughty list after <a href="https://federalnewsnetwork.com/management/2020/08/usps-seeks-rate-hike-on-commercial-packages-amid-spike-in-deliveries/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">securing approval</a> last week to hike commercial package rates during the busy holiday season (so are FedEx and UPS).</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The other concern is democracy</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">DeJoy said USPS will get "standby resources" ready for unexpected demand this fall, and reiterated yesterday that USPS is "ready today to handle whatever volume of election mail it receives." </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But USPS didn’t exactly inspire confidence after </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/32700a8b49ddf5f7594d2271eb033c2e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warning states</a></span><span> it can't guarantee mail-in ballots will be delivered on time.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At least 14 state attorneys general have sued, saying DeJoy stepped outside his authority and should have gotten approval from the Postal Regulatory Commission. Some Democrats are also asking for a probe into <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/13/elizabeth-warren-wants-probe-of-amazon-options-held-by-postal-chief-dejoy.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">his holdings</a> in USPS competitors and contractors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>Congress is in for a bundle of DeJoy in the coming days when the USPS chief chats finances with House and Senate committees. Expect USPS to get more mentions throughout this week's Democratic convention. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/18/walmart-reports-another-quarter-blowout-earnings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Curbside Your Enthusiasm
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Walmart computer loading" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fSSAyTawZcQ8eYjIBk/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Walmart computer loading" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fSSAyTawZcQ8eYjIBk/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Walmart rode the "well, there's nothing else to do...might as well shop" ethos of the pandemic to another <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/18/walmart-says-consumer-spending-dropped-as-stimulus-checks-ran-out.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">magnificent quarter</a>, according to its Q2 results yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The star of the show was—no surprise here—online U.S. sales, which nearly doubled (97% growth) over last year. U.S. same-store sales increased 9.3%, just a tick below Q1 but still much higher than any other quarter in the past few years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>As the superstore among superstores, Walmart's earnings give us insight into pandemic shopping trends. A <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/walmart-flexes-its-scale-to-power-through-pandemic-11597750961?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">few highlights</a>:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Electronics</strong></span><span>, like TVs and computers, were crazy popular, according to CEO Doug McMillon, as was more general merchandise.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Fewer trips, more stuff per trip. </strong></span><span>Shoppers decreased the frequency of errands because leaving the house is less fun these days.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Government aid </strong></span><span>was an important factor encouraging Americans to spend. Walmart said sales started to weaken after federal stimulus dried up in July. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Walmart has not only survived the pandemic, it's thriving. Just let us know when the inflatable pools are back on the shelves.</p>

ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/18/california-energy-operator-says-rolling-blackouts-come?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

California Steaming

</h1>

<img alt="California heat wave hits LA" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTM0L2NhbGlmb3JuaWFfaGVhdF93YXZlX2hpdHNfbGEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">California energy leaders, regulators, and operators are all <a href="https://deadline.com/2020/08/california-the-largest-power-outages-in-its-history-this-week-1203015664/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sniping</a> at each other like Christine and Chrishell to place blame for what could be the largest power outage in the state’s history. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>A monster heatwave is hammering California and the western U.S.—temperatures in Death Valley (130°F) came within striking distance of the highest ever recorded on Earth. On Friday and Saturday, some residents lost power with no warning, and the state energy operator <a href="https://www.politico.com/states/california/story/2020/08/18/california-has-first-rolling-blackouts-in-19-years-and-everyone-faces-blame-1309757?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> rolling blackouts are coming this week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The blame game: </strong>Gov. Newsom launched an investigation into the surprise outages on Monday. The Public Utilities Commission (PUC) blames the operator, which blames a) the PUC for not requiring utilities to hold enough energy reserves and b) the extreme heat itself, which strained both California’s and nearby states’ grids, preventing California from buying from neighbors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some trade groups blame the state’s embrace of renewable energy. Friday’s outage happened right at sundown, when the system transitioned from solar to gas-powered energy.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">U.S.:</strong> Tennessee became the tenth state to <a href="https://apnews.com/5194b4f0cc33ba5789884e2d6cab0bd8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">enact liability protections</a> against coronavirus lawsuits for businesses, schools, and nursing homes. Tennessee doesn't have a statewide mask mandate. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">South Korea:</strong> After rigorous contact tracing and testing got its outbreak under control, South Korea is <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/aug/18/south-korea-warns-it-is-on-brink-of-new-covid-crisis-as-church-linked-to-outbreak-seoul?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">teetering</a> on a second wave. Nearly 500 cases have been linked to a single church in Seoul, and if infection rates don't flatten, the government is expected to retighten restrictions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">South Africa: </strong>Following five months of super strict lockdowns, South Africa <a href="https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/virus-cases-fall-south-africa-liquor-sales-72438566?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">relaxed</a> alcohol and cigarette sale restrictions yesterday. Thanks to COVID-19 lockdowns, South Africa has <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/africa/south-africa-coronavirus-flu-season/2020/08/17/bd8aaaca-e084-11ea-82d8-5e55d47e90ca_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recorded just one flu case</a> as the season comes to a close.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">France:</strong> The Champagne Committee, France's sparkling wine authority, is <a href="https://abcnews.go.com/Business/wireStory/champagne-makers-fix-harvest-quotas-virus-kills-fizz-72444596?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">capping</a> the 2020 grape harvest 21% below last year's haul. The industry has lost $2 billion in sales because of the pandemic, and vintners are trying to limit supplies to keep prices up. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Meanwhile, in China...</strong>it's time to party? Last weekend, thousands <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/carlieporterfield/2020/08/18/wuhan-holds-huge-concert-pool-party-after-three-months-of-no-reported-coronavirus-cases/#51cd58e8e0ef?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">attended</a> a water park musical festival in Wuhan (the virus’s origin city), which hasn't reported a local infection for three months.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTMzL3BhcnR5aW5nX2luX3d1aGFuX3Bvc3QtcGFuZGVtaWMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIn0=" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>STR/AFP via Getty Images</em> </small></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BANKING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/18/citigroup-sues-hedge-fund-accidental-900m-payment?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Citi Does an Oopsi
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Mistake GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=381 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3oEjHGnY8oB4BHVTP2/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Mistake GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3oEjHGnY8oB4BHVTP2/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re embarrassed about dropping the ball at work...find comfort in not being the employees at Citi who <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/18/investing/citibank-sues-brigade-capital/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">accidentally sent</a> about $900 million to a group of Revlon lenders last week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wait, what? </strong>Citi was serving as the “administrative agent” between Revlon, the embattled cosmetics company, and its (very angry) creditors. But Citi mistakenly paid those lenders much, much more than it meant to...like, 100x the amount it intended. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Reports say Citi is </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-17/citigroup-s-900-million-loan-blunder-to-face-occ-fed-scrutiny?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explaining</a></span><span> to federal regulators how it made such a colossal gaffe, and on Monday the bank sued Brigade Capital Management, a hedge fund that won’t give some of the money back. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to court documents, Brigade is arguing the $176 million it received from Citi was intended to pay off Revlon’s entire balance. Citi says of course not—it was just an interest payment that was supposed to total $1.5 million. It called Brigade's actions "unconscionable." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The Economic Times calls it "one of the biggest <a href="https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/markets/stocks/news/citis-900-million-clerical-error-is-worst-wall-street-bungle-in-a-long-time/articleshow/77569873.cms?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">screw-ups</a> on Wall Street in ages."</p>

</a>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Podcast recs:</strong> Our very own <a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Business Casual</em></a> podcast is fantastic, but we know it's not the only entertaining biz show out there. You'll never guess who's No. 1.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Level up: </strong>Seven months in, what we <a href="https://www.statnews.com/2020/08/17/what-we-now-know-about-covid19-and-what-questions-remain-to-be-answered/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">know and don’t know</a> about COVID-19 (a great resource), plus the <a href="https://www.history.com/news/pandemics-lessons?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lessons learned</a> from pandemics past.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Scenes from the NBA bubble: </strong>Jimmy Butler’s got a <a href="https://www.sbnation.com/nba/2020/8/17/21371898/jimmy-butler-coffee-nba-bubble?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">coffee side hustle</a> and Kawhi Leonard is all of us when we <a href="https://twitter.com/gswchris/status/1295488930997923840?s=12&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">don’t want to talk to anyone</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Calling all college students: </strong>We want to hear from you.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since COVID-19 upended higher education, we’re curious how our college student readers are spending this fall, whether it's attending in-person classes, deferring for a year and hitchhiking across Siberia, or camping out in your childhood bedroom for Zoom U. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/hNDm2oG3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Let us know here</a>.</p>

The S\u0026P \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/17/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efinally closed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e at an all-time high, erasing all of its losses from the pandemic. The index is up more than 54% since hitting a low on March 23.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFeels like the word \"homebuilder\" has been in every edition of the Brew for the past month, and for \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/5c84073ef7a73318e2b72fb57b012d38?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egood reason\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e—construction of new U.S. homes boomed 22.6% last month. One analyst compared the gains to post-hurricane building activity.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\n2020\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/18/usps-pause-controversial-changes-election-day?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nToo Big to Mail\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"USPS mailbox\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTM1L3VzcHNfbWFpbGJveC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Postmaster General Louis DeJoy said \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/08/18/903477948/postmaster-general-will-testify-at-senate-hearing-friday?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehe's pausing\u003c/a\u003e controversial changes to the U.S. Postal Service until after Election Day \"to avoid even the appearance of any impact on election mail.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that means: \u003c/strong\u003eUSPS retail hours will stay the same; mailboxes and mail sorters will stay put; processing facilities will remain open; and overtime will be approved as needed. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAbout those changes\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDeJoy took over USPS in June and enacted some budget-balancing measures to right the ship at the struggling agency. Those measures included...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEliminating overtime pay \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLeaving mail at distribution centers until the next day if couriers are running late \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAn effort to encourage early retirements for non-union workers \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eReassigning or displacing 23 execs, a move that \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/08/07/postal-service-investigation-dejoy/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecentralized\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e power around DeJoy and sidelined decades of institutional knowledge, per the WaPo.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, DeJoy specified that initiatives on pause \"predate [his] arrival.\" He did not say whether recently removed or decommissioned mailboxes and sorters will be returned. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eUSPS changes have big implications for the many businesses that rely on its services. DeJoy might find himself on Santa's naughty list after \u003ca href=\"https://federalnewsnetwork.com/management/2020/08/usps-seeks-rate-hike-on-commercial-packages-amid-spike-in-deliveries/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esecuring approval\u003c/a\u003e last week to hike commercial package rates during the busy holiday season (so are FedEx and UPS).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe other concern is democracy\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDeJoy said USPS will get \"standby resources\" ready for unexpected demand this fall, and reiterated yesterday that USPS is \"ready today to handle whatever volume of election mail it receives.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut USPS didn’t exactly inspire confidence after \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/32700a8b49ddf5f7594d2271eb033c2e?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewarning states\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e it can't guarantee mail-in ballots will be delivered on time.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt least 14 state attorneys general have sued, saying DeJoy stepped outside his authority and should have gotten approval from the Postal Regulatory Commission. Some Democrats are also asking for a probe into \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/13/elizabeth-warren-wants-probe-of-amazon-options-held-by-postal-chief-dejoy.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehis holdings\u003c/a\u003e in USPS competitors and contractors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eCongress is in for a bundle of DeJoy in the coming days when the USPS chief chats finances with House and Senate committees. Expect USPS to get more mentions throughout this week's Democratic convention. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWalmart rode the \"well, there's nothing else to do...might as well shop\" ethos of the pandemic to another \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/18/walmart-says-consumer-spending-dropped-as-stimulus-checks-ran-out.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emagnificent quarter\u003c/a\u003e, according to its Q2 results yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe star of the show was—no surprise here—online U.S. sales, which nearly doubled (97% growth) over last year. U.S. same-store sales increased 9.3%, just a tick below Q1 but still much higher than any other quarter in the past few years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eAs the superstore among superstores, Walmart's earnings give us insight into pandemic shopping trends. A \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/walmart-flexes-its-scale-to-power-through-pandemic-11597750961?mod=hp_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efew highlights\u003c/a\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eElectronics\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, like TVs and computers, were crazy popular, according to CEO Doug McMillon, as was more general merchandise.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFewer trips, more stuff per trip. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShoppers decreased the frequency of errands because leaving the house is less fun these days.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGovernment aid \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ewas an important factor encouraging Americans to spend. Walmart said sales started to weaken after federal stimulus dried up in July. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWalmart has not only survived the pandemic, it's thriving. largest power outage in the state’s history. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eA monster heatwave is hammering California and the western U.S.—temperatures in Death Valley (130°F) came within striking distance of the highest ever recorded on Earth. On Friday and Saturday, some residents lost power with no warning, and the state energy operator \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/states/california/story/2020/08/18/california-has-first-rolling-blackouts-in-19-years-and-everyone-faces-blame-1309757?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e rolling blackouts are coming this week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe blame game: \u003c/strong\u003eGov. Newsom launched an investigation into the surprise outages on Monday. The Public Utilities Commission (PUC) blames the operator, which blames a) the PUC for not requiring utilities to hold enough energy reserves and b) the extreme heat itself, which strained both California’s and nearby states’ grids, preventing California from buying from neighbors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome trade groups blame the state’s embrace of renewable energy. Tennessee doesn't have a statewide mask mandate. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSouth Korea:\u003c/strong\u003e After rigorous contact tracing and testing got its outbreak under control, South Korea is \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/aug/18/south-korea-warns-it-is-on-brink-of-new-covid-crisis-as-church-linked-to-outbreak-seoul?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eteetering\u003c/a\u003e on a second wave. Nearly 500 cases have been linked to a single church in Seoul, and if infection rates don't flatten, the government is expected to retighten restrictions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSouth Africa: \u003c/strong\u003eFollowing five months of super strict lockdowns, South Africa \u003ca href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/virus-cases-fall-south-africa-liquor-sales-72438566?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erelaxed\u003c/a\u003e alcohol and cigarette sale restrictions yesterday. Thanks to COVID-19 lockdowns, South Africa has \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/africa/south-africa-coronavirus-flu-season/2020/08/17/bd8aaaca-e084-11ea-82d8-5e55d47e90ca_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecorded just one flu case\u003c/a\u003e as the season comes to a close.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFrance:\u003c/strong\u003e The Champagne Committee, France's sparkling wine authority, is \u003ca href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/Business/wireStory/champagne-makers-fix-harvest-quotas-virus-kills-fizz-72444596?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecapping\u003c/a\u003e the 2020 grape harvest 21% below last year's haul. The industry has lost $2 billion in sales because of the pandemic, and vintners are trying to limit supplies to keep prices up. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMeanwhile, in China...\u003c/strong\u003eit's time to party? style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWait, what? \u003c/strong\u003eCiti was serving as the “administrative agent” between Revlon, the embattled cosmetics company, and its (very angry) creditors. But Citi mistakenly paid those lenders much, much more than it meant to...like, 100x the amount it intended. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eReports say Citi is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-17/citigroup-s-900-million-loan-blunder-to-face-occ-fed-scrutiny?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplaining\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to federal regulators how it made such a colossal gaffe, and on Monday the bank sued Brigade Capital Management, a hedge fund that won’t give some of the money back. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to court documents, Brigade is arguing the $176 million it received from Citi was intended to pay off Revlon’s entire balance. Citi says of course not—it was just an interest payment that was supposed to total $1.5 million. It called Brigade's actions \"unconscionable.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom
